intro: Alguelagum mexicanum, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its large, white, fragrant flowers that open at night. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves and stems adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Its flowers are pollinated by moths and other nocturnal insects. Alguelagum mexicanum is also valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some indigenous cultures.
